channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [MAHOUT-718] Small refactoring to broaden the use of Google Guava
item.description: a little refactoring that introduces util classes to fetch the top k and min k elements of a collection and broadens the use of Google Guava
item.summary: Small refactoring to broaden the use of Google Guava

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Integrated in Mahout-Quality #849 (See https://builds.apache.org/hudson/job/Mahout-Quality/849/)
MAHOUT-718 Small refactoring to broaden the use of Google Guava

  • /mahout/trunk/core/src/main/java/org/apache/mahout/cf/taste/impl/similarity/SpearmanCorrelationSimilarity.java
  • /mahout/trunk/core/src/main/java/org/apache/mahout/cf/taste/hadoop/similarity/item/CountUsersCombiner.java
  • /mahout/trunk/core/src/main/java/org/apache/mahout/cf/taste/hadoop/MaybePruneRowsMapper.java
  • /mahout/trunk/core/src/main/java/org/apache/mahout/cf/taste/hadoop/als/PredictionJob.java
  • /mahout/trunk/core/src/main/java/org/apache/mahout/clustering/ClusterIterator.java

I like it, though there are many more places where stuff is close()-ed, and we have about 3-4 methods for this already. I'd be fine just using Closeables, but let's do it across the board.

Also can TopItmes use the TopK class? it's another place where the top K things are taken and I don't see that this patch touches it.

Integrated in Mahout-Quality #851 (See https://builds.apache.org/hudson/job/Mahout-Quality/851/)
In spirit of MAHOUT-718, update Google Guava, and use its collections to replace the one use of Commons Collections

srowen : http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/?root=Apache-SVN&view=rev&rev=1130639
Files :

  • /mahout/trunk/core/src/main/java/org/apache/mahout/classifier/sequencelearning/hmm/HmmModel.java
  • /mahout/trunk/pom.xml
  • /mahout/trunk/core/pom.xml

You're right, we should try to replace all the closing logic with one solution (Closeables from Guava).

I didn't touch TopItems because TopK always instantiates a new object before doing the comparison and I thought that could maybe hurt the crucial performance of TopItems. Actually I'm not sure what the cost of instantiating a few hundred or thousands objects is, maybe it's neglectible?
will continue to refactor all code closing streams, files, etc
